Class dbControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ams.dbControl

  • public class dbControl
extends java.lang.Object

      Constructor and Description
      dbControl() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void dbComd(java.lang.String sqlcmd)
      This method is aimed at making a general use method for SQL statements.
      static void dbComdUpdate(java.lang.String sqlcmd)
      dComUpdate is to be used when updating a record in the database(student presence for example) When this is called, call doClose() right after it to avoid database errors and close unneeded connections.
      static void doClose()
      Closes the connection in the agreed upon safe pattern: ResultSet ¬ Statement ¬ Connection.
      static java.sql.Connection doConnect()
      Connects to the database.
      static java.lang.String getID(java.lang.String uid)

    • Constructor Detail

      • dbControl

        public dbControl()

    • Method Detail

      • dbComd

        public static void dbComd(java.lang.String sqlcmd)
        This method is aimed at making a general use method for SQL statements. When using this method, be sure to add the "doClose();" method in your finally block in the end of the try-catch.
        Parameters:
        sqlcmd - The all-in-one SQL query (READ ONLY) method. The WRITABLE method is doComdUpdate(String)

      • dbComdUpdate

        public static void dbComdUpdate(java.lang.String sqlcmd)
        dComUpdate is to be used when updating a record in the database(student presence for example) When this is called, call doClose() right after it to avoid database errors and close unneeded connections. Generally, at the "finally" stage of a try-catch-finally.
        Parameters:
        sqlcmd - The all-in-one SQL query (UPDATABLE) method.

      • getID

        public static java.lang.String getID(java.lang.String uid)

      • doConnect

        public static java.sql.Connection doConnect()
        Connects to the database. I've had issues with this bit. It continuously tried to connect to a deleted scheme, therefore I manually set a direct connection to the schema we're using with "con.setSchema("AMS");"
        Parameters:
        username - = "test" username for the DB
        password - = "test" username for the DB
        Returns:
        con to carry out the connection to other methods

      • doClose

        public static void doClose()
        Closes the connection in the agreed upon safe pattern: ResultSet ¬ Statement ¬ Connection. Should generally be added to the finally block after the try-catch. Based on ( https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2225221/closing-database-connections-in-java )
